content: julie ridl page 1 of 4 1/18/09 iphone mitts by knittingjuju knittingjuju wordpress com for mittens in these photos i used 2 skeins 458 yards 419 meters of regia color 4- ply /4-fädig colorway 4255 23636 but really any fingering sock yarn will do size u s 2 2 75mm needles 2 markers needle and cotton thread these mitts are knit as a simple tube of 2 x 2 ribbing for the elasticity and warmth of ribbing and pattern continuity as you fold the cuff in and out as needed no it s not very imaginative nor very interesting but with luck you ve chosen an entertaining yarn which will make up for the dullness after a few inches of round-and-round you toss in a thumb gusset which you ll hold on a piece of thread after a bit you ll resume your tube knitting and when that tube is done transform the gusset into a nice thumb pattern is for a ladies medium-large mitt recommend a jump to a level 2 yarn and size 3 or 4 needles for a man mitt and down to size 1 or 0 needles for smaller hands julie ridl page 2 of 4 1/18/09 tested in the heavy michigan winter of 2008-2009 i ve found these to be super easy super practical sock yarn mittens that give you access to your favorite electronic tether doesn t have to be an iphone of course or anywhere you like to put your fingers made with a generous cuff for extra warmth and to fold inside to cover your fingertips when they absolutely must be covered in michigan sometimes they must at this writing for instance they must… julie ridl page 3 of 4 1/18/09 k= knit p=purl m1 = make one stitch pm = place marker mm = move marker pu = pick up stitches cuff cast on 68 stitches join in the round *k2 p2 repeat from * around until piece measures 5 around 45 rounds thumb gusset round 1 at the beginning of the next row k2 p2 k2 pm p1 m1 p1 pm *k2 p2 repeat from * to finish the round round 2 k2 p2 k2 mm m1 p1 k1 p1 m1 mm *k2 p2 repeat from * to finish the round round 3 and all odd rounds for the thumb gusset knit in pattern in *k2 p2* ribbing for the palm stitches and *p1 k1* ribbing between the markers for the thumb gusset round 4 and all even rounds for thumb gusset until you have 17 stitches between the markers k2 p2 k2 mm m1 knit in p1 k1 pattern to marker m1 mm *k2 p2 repeat from * to finish the round palm thread a yarn needle with a 6-inch-long piece of cotton string or some non-shedding skinny yarn round 1 k2 p2 k2 remove marker and move the 17 gusset stitches to the cotton string remove 2nd marker tie a little knot in the ends of the string
